intro: Lomatium caruifolium var. erythropodum, commonly known as the red-root lomatium, is a perennial herb native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to theApiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic, often hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and forest edges. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive reddish hue, particularly in the veins. The flowers are small, white to pale yellow, and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family.
